intro: Ebenidium pogonotropis, commonly known as the velvetleaf. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. It has a woody stem with a rough, hairy texture, and its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Ebenidium pogonotropis is also known for its potential as a medicinal plant in some traditional herbal practices.
